isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - AUXILIARY SHIFT CYLINDER

step1.para: Install O-ring in the bore of the shift cylinder ( Figure 178). Lubricate O-ring with silicone lubricant.

figure.caption: Figure 178. Install O-Ring in Bore of Shift Cylinder

step1.para: Install the cylinder housing into the rear housing bore and secure with four bolts ( Figure 179). Tighten bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 179. Install Cylinder Housing into Rear Housing Bore

step1.para: Install the shifting shaft from the front through the yoke hub and cylinder, aligning the notches with the lockscrew bores in the yoke hub ( Figure 180).

figure.caption: Figure 180. Install Shifting Shaft From Front Through Yoke Hub and Cylinder

step1.para: Install the two yoke lockscrews, tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m), and wire securely ( Figure 181).

figure.caption: Figure 181. Install and Tighten Yoke Lockscrews

step1.para: Install the O-rings in the O.D. and I.D. of the piston ( Figure 182). Lubricate with silicone lubricant.

figure.caption: Figure 182. Install O-Rings in O.D. and I.D. of Piston

step1.para: Install the piston on the shifting shaft, flat side out ( Figure ).

figure.caption: Figure 183. Install Piston on Shifting Shaft

step1.para: Install the locknut on the shifting shaft ( Figure 184). Tighten to 70 to 85 ft-lbs. (95 to 115 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 184. Install and Tighten Locknut on Shifting Shaft

step1.para: Install the shift cylinder cover with four bolts ( Figure 185). Tighten bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m).
